title: How to Make "Bonne Femme" Soup

steps.headline: Wash and shred the lettuce heart finely.
steps.description: Cut the cucumber into thin slices and then into thin strips. Refer to Chiffonade and Julienne cuts for instructions how.

steps.headline: Melt the butter or dripping in the soup pot and sauté the vegetables gently for 5-6 minutes until softened.
Add the stock, salt and pepper to taste and simmer for 10-15 minutes and allow to cool slightly (to approx 60C / 140F, but it is approximate).
Meanwhile, beat the egg yolks and cream / milk until smooth.
steps.description: Pour through a fine sieve if desired, but if the mix is completely blended it is unnecessary.

steps.headline: Add the cream mix to the cooled soup and reheat gently, stirring well until just thickened.
steps.description: Do NOT boil - it will curdle. Cooling the soup in advance prevents the egg mix from cooking too fast.)

steps.headline: Stir in the chopped herbs and serve immediately.

text: Wash and shred the lettuce heart finely. Cut the cucumber into thin slices and then into thin strips. Refer to Chiffonade and Julienne cuts for instructions how. Melt the butter or dripping in the soup pot and sauté the vegetables gently for 5-6 minutes until softened.  Add the stock, salt and pepper to taste and simmer for 10-15 minutes and allow to cool slightly (to approx 60C / 140F, but it is approximate).  Meanwhile, beat the egg yolks and cream / milk until smooth. Pour through a fine sieve if desired, but if the mix is completely blended it is unnecessary. Add the cream mix to the cooled soup and reheat gently, stirring well until just thickened. Do NOT boil - it will curdle. Cooling the soup in advance prevents the egg mix from cooking too fast.) Stir in the chopped herbs and serve immediately.  Finished.
